title: Need a condensed serif for a nameplate
content:
Hi,

I’m working on an insurance industry magazine and want to set the nameplate in a condensed or tall serif, maybe transitional or modern. The magazine is the market leader so I want to convey a sense of prestige but am also looking for something distinctive.

I’d really appreciate your suggestions! I love this board!

 [‹ Translating into Korean?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708213142/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44926 "Go to previous forum topic") [Monograms ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708213142/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44746 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ulee

comments.content: [Sumner Stone](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708213142/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Sumner%252BStone)’s [Arepo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708213142/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/arepo/) is underused and very elegant if used at a minimum of 36 pt.

If you’re looking for something a little more prosaic than the elegant Arepo, you might consider Whitman Display Compressed. The fonts are currently only available through the Font Bureau Studio library, but I’m hoping that we’ll be releasing these to Retail in the next month or two.

I show a few examples here: [http://www.kentlew.com/WhitmDisOverview3.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708213142/http:/www.kentlew.com/WhitmDisOverview3.html "http://www.kentlew.com/WhitmDisOverview3.html")

Also, a PDF here: [http://www.kentlew.com/Type/WhitmanDisplay\_Sample.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708213142/http:/www.kentlew.com/Type/WhitmanDisplay_Sample.pdf "http://www.kentlew.com/Type/WhitmanDisplay\_Sample.pdf")

If you can tell us the name of your magazine, I’d be happy to set a screen sample.

— K.
[Kepler](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708213142/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/kepler/) has lovely condensed serifs. Optically sizes too.
I have many strong options in my type library; if you give us the text to be set I can show you some.

Thanks for all your suggestions! I’m leaning towards Kepler, I might be bugging y’all again soon.

Cheers!
